sentences: Ühtki inimene ei tohi teisi tappa.
Ahinsa on printsiip, et mitte kahjustada ühtki olendit.
context: In Estonian grammar, 'ühtki' is an indefinite pronoun that functions as a negative quantifier. It's used to express the absence or non-existence of something, similar to English words like 'not any,' 'no one,' or 'nothing.' This word typically appears in negative contexts and helps negate the existence of countable nouns.
